us.title: Strategist: 'Wishful thinking' to expect a rebound for U.S. stocks in the second half of 2025
us.content: Peter Berezin of BCA Research is calling for a recession as the U.S. consumer outlook weakens. He is also worried about budget negotiations as Trump could push through un-funded tax cuts, which will push up bond yields.

us.title: Constellation Energy: Price Drop And Robust Results Make It Attractive
us.content: Constellation Energy Group's stock dropped 18% since October on broader concerns around nuclear energy's expected growth, despite strong Q4 and full-year 2024 results, with EPS exceeding expectations by 2.7%. There's much going for CEG, though. The company's 2025 guidance suggests a 6.7% EPS increase, but past trends indicate potential for a higher rise, possibly up to 23.1%. Market multiples are also attractive now, with forward P/E at 23.6x, down from 32.9x in October 2024, reflecting improved valuation.

us.title: This Simple Industrials ETF Could Turn $1,000 a Month Into $612,000
us.content: Over the past few months, concerns regarding unpredictable tariffs, sticky inflation, and elevated interest rates drove many investors away from macro-sensitive industrial stocks. However, many water stocks bucked that sectorwide downturn.

us.title: Costco Stock Sell-Off: Time to Buy the Dip?
us.content: After surging to a 52-week high of about $1,078 earlier this year, shares of membership-based retailer Costco Wholesale (COST 0.39%) took a huge hit. On the surface, the stock declined because the company reported worse-than-expected fiscal Q2 earnings per share and because of the higher costs Costco could face from tariffs.

us.title: 'RUNAWAY INFLATION': Finances 'deteriorated' under Biden, says economist
us.content: Unleash Prosperity senior fellow EJ Antoni breaks down the economic impact of housing for illegal immigrants on 'The Bottom Line.' #house #economy #biden #bottomline

us.title: The US will see monetary inflation in the next few years unless the Fed realizes this, expert warns
us.content: 'Kudlow' panelists Steve Forbes, Art Laffer and Steve Moore discuss growing the economy and responding to inflation. #inflation #foxbusiness

us.title: U.S. government spending cuts riskier than Trump's tariffs: Invesco
us.content: David Chao, Global Market Strategist, APAC from Invesco says tariff risks are temporary, while he expresses greater concern over shifts in U.S. government spending which could have a more significant impact on the U.S. economy. He also reveals his top investment strategies, and identifies key opportunities for investors.

us.title: CNBC CFO Council Survey on biggest risks for business and their outlook on the U.S. economy
us.content: CNBC's Frank Holland shares latest on CFO Council Survey.

us.title: Super Group: The Bet's Still On
us.content: Super Group reported exceptional Q4 growth, driven by growth in many African markets and Canada, among other markets. Underlying active user growth was also solid. The company is driving operating leverage in maturing markets, while still continuing to rapidly invest in marketing to create a loyal user base. The iGaming business in the US remains weak, and is still guided to be highly unprofitable in 2025 despite noteworthy growth. The total impact on earnings is still moderate.

us.title: Tesla hit as Canada suspends EV rebate payments following Trump tariff slap
us.content: Canada has suspended all electric vehicle rebate payments to Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) and barred the company from future federal EV incentive programmes, citing concerns over US trade actions. Transport Minister Chrystia Freeland said no funds would be released until each claim is individually verified.

us.title: Bitcoin, Crypto Market's $400B Recovery Could Be a Bull Trap
us.content: Crypto markets have added $400B since early March, but a bearish rising wedge pattern, high correlation with U.S. stocks, and macroeconomic risks suggest the rebound may be a bull trap.

us.title: We're not witnessing a typical private sector capex boom, says Jim Cramer
us.content: 'Mad Money' host Jim Cramer gives his take on capex spending and whether the market is in the middle of a boom or bubble.

us.title: Jim Cramer talks the bull and bear cases for the data center buildout thesis
us.content: 'Mad Money' host Jim Cramer gives his take on capex spending in the data sector and whether the market is in the middle of a boom or bubble.

us.title: 'Fast Money' traders discuss if the consumer could be the canary in the coal mine for the economy
us.content: 'Fast Money' traders discuss if the consumer could be the canary in the coal mine for the economy.

us.title: Crusoe Energy sells Bitcoin mining arm to NYDIG, turns focus to AI
us.content: United States-based Bitcoin miner Crusoe Energy is wrapping up its Bitcoin mining business as it plans to shift focus towards the artificial intelligence sector.

france.title: This 7.7%-Yielding Dividend Stock Has Maintained Its Payment for 24 Quarters in a Row. Can That Streak Continue in 2025?
france.content: It's been a rough period for investors in commodity chemical companies. Dow Inc. (DOW -2.63%) and its peer LyondellBasell have seen their stock prices collapse to four-year lows -- with both stocks down over 29% in the last year.

france.title: GameStop Board Unanimously Approves Bitcoin As Treasury Reserve Asset
france.content: In a significant move for the video game retail giant, GameStop announced on Tuesday that its board has unanimously approved a plan to use corporate cash reserves to invest in the crypto market's largest cryptocurrency, Bitcoin (BTC). This decision mirrors a strategy made by the now Bitcoin proxy company Strategy (previously Microstrategy) by MicroStrategy, which has made headlines for its substantial Bitcoin acquisitions led by its co-founder Michael Saylor.

france.title: Nu Holdings: Credit Woes Cloud A Bright Future
france.content: Nu Holdings continues to grow rapidly with 114 million customers, but recent financial results were disappointing due to rising credit losses and currency depreciation. The 7% delinquency rate has raised investor concerns about risk management amid aggressive loan expansion. A sharp fall in the Brazilian Real hurt USD-reported results, though Brazil's economy remains fundamentally strong.

france.title: Porsche skids to a €20bn loss after VW write-down
france.content: Porsche AG (ETR:P911) reported a €20 billion after-tax loss due to a writedown on its Volskagen stake. As a result, the holding company proposed a lower dividend of €1.91 per preference share, down from €2.56 last year, reflecting reduced income from Volkswagen, which saw a 15% decline in operating profits.

france.title: McCormick Posts Q1 Earnings Miss, But Full-Year Outlook Holds Firm
france.content:
McCormick (NYSE:MKC) announced its first-quarter earnings, which fell short of Wall Street expectations, despite revenue meeting forecasts and guidance remaining unchanged.

For the quarter, the spice and flavoring maker reported adjusted earnings per share of $0.60, below the $0.64 consensus estimate. Revenue held steady at $1.61 billion, matching expectations but reflecting flat year-over-year growth.

The company’s 2% increase in sales volume was offset by a 2% foreign currency headwind, keeping overall top-line growth neutral. McCormick’s Consumer segment saw a 1% rise in organic sales, while Flavor Solutions posted 3% organic growth, signaling steady demand across its core business units.

Despite the soft Q1 earnings, McCormick reaffirmed its full-year guidance, expecting adjusted EPS in the range of $3.03 to $3.08, closely aligned with the $3.07 consensus. The company also maintained its projection of 1–3% organic sales growth for fiscal 2025.

france.title: Does ExxonMobil Have the Fuel to Grow Into a $1 Trillion Company?
france.content: ExxonMobil (XOM 0.64%) is the 800-pound gorilla in the oil patch. The energy giant currently has a market cap of more than $500 billion.

france.title: Turkey's Simsek Vows 'Whatever it Takes' to Stabilize Markets
france.content: Turkey's Finance Minister Mehmet Simsek promised to do "whatever it takes" to stabilize financial markets, according to people who joined a teleconference organized by Citigroup Inc. and Deutsche Bank. Simsek's comment follow last week's detention and later arrest of Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan's key political rival.

france.title: Zhihu Inc. Reports Unaudited Fourth Quarter and Fiscal Year 2024 Financial Results
france.content: BEIJING , March 26, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Zhihu Inc. ("Zhihu" or the "Company") (NYSE: ZH; HKEX: 2390), a leading online content community in China, today announced its unaudited financial results for the quarter and fiscal year ended December 31, 2024. Fourth Quarter 2024 Highlights Total revenues were RMB859.2 million (US$117.7 million) in the fourth quarter of 2024, compared with RMB1,138.3 million in the same period of 2023.

france.title: UK Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency Confirms Acceptance of Marketing Authorization Application for Proposed Biosimilar to Xolair® (omalizumab)
france.content: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, PISCATAWAY, N.J. and LONDON, March 26, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Alvotech (NASDAQ: ALVO), a global biotech company specializing in the development and manufacturing of biosimilar medicines for patients worldwide, Kashiv Biosciences LLC (“Kashiv”), a fully integrated biopharmaceutical company headquartered in New Jersey, US, and Advanz Pharma, a UK-headquartered global pharmaceutical company with a strategic focus on specialty, hospital, and rare disease medicines, today announced that the UK Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) has accepted a marketing application for AVT23, a proposed biosimilar to Xolair® (omalizumab), a biologic indicated for treatment of severe persistent allergic asthma and chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyps. Global sales of Xolair in 2024 were about USD $4.4 billion [1].

Global sales of Xolair in 2024 were about USD $4.4 billion [1].
